channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Afghanistan: Street fighting rages as Taliban attack key city
item.description: The militants are battling to take control of a provincial capital for the first time in years.

item.title: Vitaly Shishov: Head of Belarusian group missing in Kyiv
item.description: Vitaly Shishov was reported missing by his partner after failing to return from his morning jog.

item.title: Transgender athlete Hubbard out of Olympics
item.description: Transgender athlete Laurel Hubbard makes Olympic history but fails to record a successful lift in the women's +87kg weightlifting.

item.title: UK and Iran summon diplomats after tanker attack
item.description: Two people were killed in the attack on an oil tanker, which the UK, US and Israel blame on Iran.

item.title: Turkey wildfires: Eight dead as blazes sweep through tourist resorts
item.description: Firefighters battle blazes in soaring temperatures as wildfires ravage resorts in southern Europe.

item.title: Sheikh Jarrah: Palestinians reject offer to end evictions threat
item.description: A plan to end a long-running saga which has fuelled Israel-Palestinian tensions is turned down.

item.title: Kenya's first female paraglider on life from a bird's eye view
item.description: "Kenya 1" aka Nyambura Kariuki, shares her thoughts on being Kenya's first ever female paraglider.

item.title: Kathy Griffin: US comedian has surgery after lung cancer diagnosis
item.description: Kathy Griffin is having half of her left lung removed, saying "doctors are very optimistic".

item.title: German court sets trial for 100-year-old alleged Nazi guard
item.description: The man is accused of assisting in 3,518 murders at the Sachsenhausen camp during World War Two.

item.title: Anthony Barajas: US TikToker dies after 'unprovoked' cinema shooting
item.description: The suspected shooter, Joseph Jimenez, 20, appeared in Riverside County Superior Court on Friday.

item.title: Matt Damon's daughter stopped him using a gay slur
item.description: The actor vowed to never use term again after his daughter explained to him why it was unacceptable.

item.title: China Covid: Concerns grow as Delta outbreak spreads
item.description: Authorities are carrying out mass testing and have imposed sweeping lockdowns across 15 provinces.

item.title: West faces dilemmas over tanker attack
item.description: A drone attack on a ship off the coast of Oman has worsened already strained ties with Iran.

item.title: Nigerian student shocked to see friend's body in anatomy class
item.description: Nigerian students often dissect "unclaimed" bodies from mortuaries but some are victims of police violence.

item.title: Iran water: What's causing the shortages?
item.description: Iranian officials have warned of historic drought while experts blame years of poor water management.

item.title: Then and now: The burning issue of wildfires
item.description: Scientists are increasingly concerned climate change is making fires more frequent and more intense.

item.title: Finding answers to the world's drinking water crisis
item.description: Scientists are racing to come up with technologies that can solve the world's clean water shortage.

item.title: Nairobi - the centre of East Africa's thriving arts scene
item.description: Artists from across East Africa have converged on Kenya's capital, creating a vibrant scene.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The medal winners' flowers that pay tribute to 2011 disaster
item.description: More than 5,000 bouquets are being handed to athletes at the Olympic and Paralympic Games - and have a special significance, with flowers from areas devastated by a 2011 earthquake and tsunami.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: A parent's plea in the shadow of the Olympics
item.description: This dad is drawing attention to what he calls the kidnapping of children by their own parents in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: 'You can take our flag but not our love for Russia'
item.description: Russia may be banned from the Olympics, but Russians are still winning medals â€“ and rivals aren't happy.

item.title: 'The reason I'm doing this is because I was inspired by him'
item.description: Karim al-Jian was inspired to study medicine, after learning about a doctor who was killed helping civilians in Syria.

item.title: Turkey: People flee popular tourist spots to escape wildfires
item.description: Footage has emerged showing people fleeing the deadly fires which have engulfed parts of Turkey.

item.title: Afghanistan: Orphan's reunion with British soldier after 19 years
item.description: Ramin Paikar was among the orphans visited by British soldiers stationed in Kabul in 2002.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sifan Hassan takes 5,000m gold in first leg of attempted treble
item.description: Sifan Hassan takes 5,000m gold as she bids for an unprecedented Olympic treble on the track in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Mijain Lopez wins fourth straight gold in Greco-Roman wrestling
item.description: Greco-Roman wrestler Mijain Lopez cements his position in the record books by winning his fourth straight Olympic gold medal.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Simone Biles on start list for beam final
item.description: Simone Biles will compete in the beam final as she takes up her final chance of an individual medal at an Olympics where she has withdrawn from four other finals.

item.title: Women's Olympic football: Canada beat USA to set up Sweden final
item.description: Canada secured a 1-0 victory over world champions the United States to set up a women's Olympic football final against Sweden at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain eventers win team gold and Tom McEwen claims individual silver
item.description: Great Britain win Olympic team eventing gold for the first time in 49 years and Tom McEwen adds a silver in the individual category.

item.title: How a trick no woman had done before won a gold
item.description: A trick revered, unexpected and never done by a woman before - what is the backflip 360 pulled off by Charlotte Worthington?
